meanings.definition: To stretch or exert to the utmost
meanings.sent1: She strains to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: He strains his muscles lifting heavy boxes.
meanings.sent3: The tree strains to touch the sky.
meanings.sent4: The athlete strains against his limits.
meanings.sent5: The fabric strains under the weight.

meanings.definition: A particular breed or stock of animals
meanings.sent1: The farm has different strains of chickens.
meanings.sent2: The zoo welcomed a new strain of pandas.
meanings.sent3: The rare strain of horses was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The strain of sheep had unique markings.
meanings.sent5: The strain of dogs was known for its loyalty.

meanings.sent1: The strains of the violin filled the room.
meanings.sent2: She hummed the familiar strain of the song.
meanings.sent3: The strain of the flute made everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: The strain of the piano echoed through the hall.
meanings.sent5: The strains of the choir were harmonious.

meanings.definition: To injure by overuse or improper use
meanings.sent1: He strains his back by lifting incorrectly.
meanings.sent2: She strains her eyes by staring at the screen too long.
meanings.sent3: The old chair strains under his weight.
meanings.sent4: The constant typing strains her wrists.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive motion strains his joints.

meanings.sent1: She strains the pasta before serving.
meanings.sent2: He strains the tea leaves to make a cup of tea.
meanings.sent3: The chef strains the sauce to remove lumps.
meanings.sent4: The coffee maker strains the coffee grounds.
meanings.sent5: The sieve strains out the impurities.

meanings.sent2: He strains the rope to secure the boat.
meanings.sent3: The cold weather strains the fabric of the tent.
meanings.sent4: The tight deadline strains the team's resources.
meanings.sent5: The emotional conversation strains their bond.
